info.title: Appwrite
info.description: Appwrite backend as a service cuts up to 70% of the time and costs required for building a modern application. We abstract and simplify common development tasks behind a REST APIs, to help you develop your app in a fast and secure way. For full API documentation and tutorials go to [https://appwrite.io/docs](https://appwrite.io/docs)

get.description: Get currently logged in user data as JSON object.

post.description: Use this endpoint to allow a new user to register a new account in your project. After the user registration completes successfully, you can use the [/account/verfication](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createVerification) route to start verifying the user email address. To allow the new user to login to their new account, you need to create a new [account session](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createEmailSession).

userId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

password.description: User password. Must be at least 8 chars.

patch.description:
Update currently logged in user account email address. After changing user address, the user confirmation status will get reset. A new confirmation email is not sent automatically however you can use the send confirmation email endpoint again to send the confirmation email. For security measures, user password is required to complete this request.
This endpoint can also be used to convert an anonymous account to a normal one, by passing an email address and a new password.

password.description: User password. Must be at least 8 chars.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a JSON Web Token. You can use the resulting JWT to authenticate on behalf of the current user when working with the Appwrite server-side API and SDKs. The JWT secret is valid for 15 minutes from its creation and will be invalid if the user will logout in that time frame.

get.description: Get currently logged in user list of latest security activity logs. Each log returns user IP address, location and date and time of log.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Only supported methods are limit and offset

patch.description: Update currently logged in user account name.

Update currently logged in user password. For validation, user is required to pass in the new password, and the old password. For users created with OAuth, Team Invites and Magic URL, oldPassword is optional.

password.description: New user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

oldPassword.description: Current user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

patch.description: Update the currently logged in user's phone number. After updating the phone number, the phone verification status will be reset. A confirmation SMS is not sent automatically, however you can use the [POST /account/verification/phone](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/account#createPhoneVerification) endpoint to send a confirmation SMS.

phone.description: Phone number. Format this number with a leading '+' and a country code, e.g., +16175551212.

password.description: User password. Must be at least 8 chars.

get.description: Get currently logged in user preferences as a key-value object.

patch.description: Update currently logged in user account preferences. The object you pass is stored as is, and replaces any previous value. The maximum allowed prefs size is 64kB and throws error if exceeded.

post.description: Sends the user an email with a temporary secret key for password reset. When the user clicks the confirmation link he is redirected back to your app password reset URL with the secret key and email address values attached to the URL query string. Use the query string params to submit a request to the [PUT /account/recovery](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updateVerification) endpoint to complete the process. The verification link sent to the user's email address is valid for 1 hour.

url.description: URL to redirect the user back to your app from the recovery email. Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

put.description:
Use this endpoint to complete the user account password reset. Both the **userId** and **secret** arguments will be passed as query parameters to the redirect URL you have provided when sending your request to the [POST /account/recovery](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createRecovery) endpoint.

Please note that in order to avoid a [Redirect Attack](https://github.com/OWASP/CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.md) the only valid redirect URLs are the ones from domains you have set when adding your platforms in the console interface.

userId.description: User ID.

password.description: New user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

passwordAgain.description: Repeat new user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

get.description: Get currently logged in user list of active sessions across different devices.

delete.description: Delete all sessions from the user account and remove any sessions cookies from the end client.

post.description: Use this endpoint to allow a new user to register an anonymous account in your project. This route will also create a new session for the user. To allow the new user to convert an anonymous account to a normal account, you need to update its [email and password](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updateEmail) or create an [OAuth2 session](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createOAuth2Session).
Allow the user to login into their account by providing a valid email and password combination. This route will create a new session for the user.

password.description: User password. Must be at least 8 chars.

post.description: Sends the user an email with a secret key for creating a session. If the provided user ID has not be registered, a new user will be created. When the user clicks the link in the email, the user is redirected back to the URL you provided with the secret key and userId values attached to the URL query string. Use the query string parameters to submit a request to the [PUT /account/sessions/magic-url](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updateMagicURLSession) endpoint to complete the login process. The link sent to the user's email address is valid for 1 hour. If you are on a mobile device you can leave the URL parameter empty, so that the login completion will be handled by your Appwrite instance by default.

userId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

url.description: URL to redirect the user back to your app from the magic URL login. Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

put.description:
Use this endpoint to complete creating the session with the Magic URL. Both the **userId** and **secret** arguments will be passed as query parameters to the redirect URL you have provided when sending your request to the [POST /account/sessions/magic-url](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createMagicURLSession) endpoint.

Please note that in order to avoid a [Redirect Attack](https://github.com/OWASP/CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.md) the only valid redirect URLs are the ones from domains you have set when adding your platforms in the console interface.

userId.description: User ID.

get.description:
Allow the user to login to their account using the OAuth2 provider of their choice. Each OAuth2 provider should be enabled from the Appwrite console first. Use the success and failure arguments to provide a redirect URL's back to your app when login is completed.

If there is already an active session, the new session will be attached to the logged-in account. If there are no active sessions, the server will attempt to look for a user with the same email address as the email received from the OAuth2 provider and attach the new session to the existing user. If no matching user is found - the server will create a new user..

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: OAuth2 Provider. Currently, supported providers are: amazon, apple, auth0, authentik, autodesk, bitbucket, bitly, box, dailymotion, discord, disqus, dropbox, etsy, facebook, github, gitlab, google, linkedin, microsoft, notion, okta, paypal, paypalSandbox, podio, salesforce, slack, spotify, stripe, tradeshift, tradeshiftBox, twitch, wordpress, yahoo, yammer, yandex, zoom.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: URL to redirect back to your app after a successful login attempt.  Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

parameters.name: failure
parameters.description: URL to redirect back to your app after a failed login attempt.  Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

parameters.name: scopes
parameters.description: A list of custom OAuth2 scopes. Check each provider internal docs for a list of supported scopes. Maximum of 100 scopes are allowed, each 4096 characters long.

post.description: Sends the user an SMS with a secret key for creating a session. If the provided user ID has not be registered, a new user will be created. Use the returned user ID and secret and submit a request to the [PUT /account/sessions/phone](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updatePhoneSession) endpoint to complete the login process. The secret sent to the user's phone is valid for 15 minutes.

userId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

phone.description: Phone number. Format this number with a leading '+' and a country code, e.g., +16175551212.

put.description: Use this endpoint to complete creating a session with SMS. Use the **userId** from the [createPhoneSession](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#createPhoneSession) endpoint and the **secret** received via SMS to successfully update and confirm the phone session.

userId.description: User ID.

get.description: Use this endpoint to get a logged in user's session using a Session ID. Inputting 'current' will return the current session being used.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Session ID. Use the string 'current' to get the current device session.

patch.description: Access tokens have limited lifespan and expire to mitigate security risks. If session was created using an OAuth provider, this route can be used to "refresh" the access token.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Session ID. Use the string 'current' to update the current device session.

delete.description: Use this endpoint to log out the currently logged in user from all their account sessions across all of their different devices. When using the Session ID argument, only the unique session ID provided is deleted.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Session ID. Use the string 'current' to delete the current device session.

patch.description: Block the currently logged in user account. Behind the scene, the user record is not deleted but permanently blocked from any access. To completely delete a user, use the Users API instead.

post.description:
Use this endpoint to send a verification message to your user email address to confirm they are the valid owners of that address. Both the **userId** and **secret** arguments will be passed as query parameters to the URL you have provided to be attached to the verification email. The provided URL should redirect the user back to your app and allow you to complete the verification process by verifying both the **userId** and **secret** parameters. Learn more about how to [complete the verification process](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updateVerification). The verification link sent to the user's email address is valid for 7 days.

Please note that in order to avoid a [Redirect Attack](https://github.com/OWASP/CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.md), the only valid redirect URLs are the ones from domains you have set when adding your platforms in the console interface.

url.description: URL to redirect the user back to your app from the verification email. Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

put.description: Use this endpoint to complete the user email verification process. Use both the **userId** and **secret** parameters that were attached to your app URL to verify the user email ownership. If confirmed this route will return a 200 status code.

userId.description: User ID.

post.description: Use this endpoint to send a verification SMS to the currently logged in user. This endpoint is meant for use after updating a user's phone number using the [accountUpdatePhone](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updatePhone) endpoint. Learn more about how to [complete the verification process](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#updatePhoneVerification). The verification code sent to the user's phone number is valid for 15 minutes.

put.description: Use this endpoint to complete the user phone verification process. Use the **userId** and **secret** that were sent to your user's phone number to verify the user email ownership. If confirmed this route will return a 200 status code.

userId.description: User ID.

get.description:
You can use this endpoint to show different browser icons to your users. The code argument receives the browser code as it appears in your user [GET /account/sessions](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/account#listSessions) endpoint. Use width, height and quality arguments to change the output settings.

When one dimension is specified and the other is 0, the image is scaled with preserved aspect ratio. If both dimensions are 0, the API provides an image at source quality. If dimensions are not specified, the default size of image returned is 100x100px.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Image width. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Image height. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Image quality. Pass an integer between 0 to 100. Defaults to 100.

get.description:
The credit card endpoint will return you the icon of the credit card provider you need. Use width, height and quality arguments to change the output settings.

When one dimension is specified and the other is 0, the image is scaled with preserved aspect ratio. If both dimensions are 0, the API provides an image at source quality. If dimensions are not specified, the default size of image returned is 100x100px.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Credit Card Code. Possible values: amex, argencard, cabal, censosud, diners, discover, elo, hipercard, jcb, mastercard, naranja, targeta-shopping, union-china-pay, visa, mir, maestro.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Image width. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Image height. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Image quality. Pass an integer between 0 to 100. Defaults to 100.

get.description: Use this endpoint to fetch the favorite icon (AKA favicon) of any remote website URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Website URL which you want to fetch the favicon from.

get.description:
You can use this endpoint to show different country flags icons to your users. The code argument receives the 2 letter country code. Use width, height and quality arguments to change the output settings. Country codes follow the [ISO 3166-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) standard.

When one dimension is specified and the other is 0, the image is scaled with preserved aspect ratio. If both dimensions are 0, the API provides an image at source quality. If dimensions are not specified, the default size of image returned is 100x100px.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Country Code. ISO Alpha-2 country code format.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Image width. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Image height. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Image quality. Pass an integer between 0 to 100. Defaults to 100.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to fetch a remote image URL and crop it to any image size you want. This endpoint is very useful if you need to crop and display remote images in your app or in case you want to make sure a 3rd party image is properly served using a TLS protocol.

When one dimension is specified and the other is 0, the image is scaled with preserved aspect ratio. If both dimensions are 0, the API provides an image at source quality. If dimensions are not specified, the default size of image returned is 400x400px.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Image URL which you want to crop.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Resize preview image width, Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 400.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Resize preview image height, Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 400.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to show your user initials avatar icon on your website or app. By default, this route will try to print your logged-in user name or email initials. You can also overwrite the user name if you pass the 'name' parameter. If no name is given and no user is logged, an empty avatar will be returned.

You can use the color and background params to change the avatar colors. By default, a random theme will be selected. The random theme will persist for the user's initials when reloading the same theme will always return for the same initials.

When one dimension is specified and the other is 0, the image is scaled with preserved aspect ratio. If both dimensions are 0, the API provides an image at source quality. If dimensions are not specified, the default size of image returned is 100x100px.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Full Name. When empty, current user name or email will be used. Max length: 128 chars.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Image width. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Image height. Pass an integer between 0 to 2000. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: background
parameters.description: Changes background color. By default a random color will be picked and stay will persistent to the given name.

get.description: Converts a given plain text to a QR code image. You can use the query parameters to change the size and style of the resulting image.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Plain text to be converted to QR code image.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: QR code size. Pass an integer between 1 to 1000. Defaults to 400.

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: Margin from edge. Pass an integer between 0 to 10. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Return resulting image with 'Content-Disposition: attachment ' headers for the browser to start downloading it. Pass 0 for no header, or 1 for otherwise. Default value is set to 0.

get.description: Get a list of all databases from the current Appwrite project. You can use the search parameter to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Create a new Database.

databaseId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

get.summary: Get usage stats for the database

get.description: Get a database by its unique ID. This endpoint response returns a JSON object with the database metadata.

put.description: Update a database by its unique ID.

delete.description: Delete a database by its unique ID. Only API keys with with databases.write scope can delete a database.

get.description: Get a list of all collections that belong to the provided databaseId. You can use the search parameter to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name, enabled, documentSecurity

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Create a new Collection. Before using this route, you should create a new database resource using either a [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection) API or directly from your database console.

collectionId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

permissions.description: An array of permissions strings. By default no user is granted with any permissions. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

documentSecurity.description: Enables configuring permissions for individual documents. A user needs one of document or collection level permissions to access a document. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

get.description: Get a collection by its unique ID. This endpoint response returns a JSON object with the collection metadata.

put.description: Update a collection by its unique ID.

permissions.description: An array of permission strings. By default the current permission are inherited. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

documentSecurity.description: Enables configuring permissions for individual documents. A user needs one of document or collection level permissions to access a document. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

delete.description: Delete a collection by its unique ID. Only users with write permissions have access to delete this resource.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

post.description: Create a boolean attribute.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

default.description: Default value for the attribute in ISO 8601 format. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create an email attribute.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

elements.description: Array of elements in enumerated type. Uses length of longest element to determine size. Maximum of 100 elements are allowed, each 4096 characters long.

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create a float attribute. Optionally, minimum and maximum values can be provided.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

min.description: Minimum value to enforce on new documents

max.description: Maximum value to enforce on new documents

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create an integer attribute. Optionally, minimum and maximum values can be provided.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

min.description: Minimum value to enforce on new documents

max.description: Maximum value to enforce on new documents

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create IP address attribute.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create a string attribute.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

size.description: Attribute size for text attributes, in number of characters.

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

post.description: Create a URL attribute.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

200.description: AttributeDatetime, or AttributeBoolean, or AttributeInteger, or AttributeFloat, or AttributeEmail, or AttributeEnum, or AttributeURL, or AttributeIP, or AttributeDatetime, or AttributeString

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

get.description: Get a list of all the user's documents in a given collection. You can use the query params to filter your results.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long.

post.description: Create a new Document. Before using this route, you should create a new collection resource using either a [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection) API or directly from your database console.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection). Make sure to define attributes before creating documents.

documentId.description: Document ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

permissions.description: An array of permissions strings. By default the current user is granted with all permissions. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

get.description: Get a document by its unique ID. This endpoint response returns a JSON object with the document data.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

patch.description: Update a document by its unique ID. Using the patch method you can pass only specific fields that will get updated.

data.description: Document data as JSON object. Include only attribute and value pairs to be updated.

permissions.description: An array of permissions strings. By default the current permissions are inherited. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

delete.description: Delete a document by its unique ID.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

get.description: Get the document activity logs list by its unique ID.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Only supported methods are limit and offset

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

attributes.description: Array of attributes to index. Maximum of 100 attributes are allowed, each 32 characters long.

orders.description: Array of index orders. Maximum of 100 orders are allowed.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Collection ID. You can create a new collection using the Database service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/databases#createCollection).

get.description: Get the collection activity logs list by its unique ID.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Only supported methods are limit and offset

get.summary: Get usage stats for a collection

get.description: Get the database activity logs list by its unique ID.

parameters.name: queries

get.description: Get a list of all the project's functions. You can use the query params to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name, enabled, runtime, deployment, schedule, scheduleNext, schedulePrevious, timeout

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Create a new function. You can pass a list of [permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions) to allow different project users or team with access to execute the function using the client API.

functionId.description: Function ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

execute.description: An array of strings with execution roles. By default no user is granted with any execute permissions. [learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions). Maximum of 100 roles are allowed, each 64 characters long.

events.description: Events list. Maximum of 100 events are allowed.

timeout.description: Function maximum execution time in seconds.

get.description: Get a list of all runtimes that are currently active on your instance.
Get a function by its unique ID.

put.description: Update function by its unique ID.

execute.description: An array of strings with execution roles. By default no user is granted with any execute permissions. [learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions). Maximum of 100 roles are allowed, each 64 characters long.

events.description: Events list. Maximum of 100 events are allowed.

delete.description: Delete a function by its unique ID.

get.description: Get a list of all the project's code deployments. You can use the query params to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: entrypoint, size, buildId, activate

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description:
Create a new function code deployment. Use this endpoint to upload a new version of your code function. To execute your newly uploaded code, you'll need to update the function's deployment to use your new deployment UID.

This endpoint accepts a tar.gz file compressed with your code. Make sure to include any dependencies your code has within the compressed file. You can learn more about code packaging in the [Appwrite Cloud Functions tutorial](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/functions).

Use the "command" param to set the entry point used to execute your code.

code.description: Gzip file with your code package. When used with the Appwrite CLI, pass the path to your code directory, and the CLI will automatically package your code. Use a path that is within the current directory.

activate.description: Automatically activate the deployment when it is finished building.

get.description: Get a code deployment by its unique ID.

patch.description: Update the function code deployment ID using the unique function ID. Use this endpoint to switch the code deployment that should be executed by the execution endpoint.

delete.description: Delete a code deployment by its unique ID.

get.description: Get a list of all the current user function execution logs. You can use the query params to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: trigger, status, statusCode, duration

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Trigger a function execution. The returned object will return you the current execution status. You can ping the `Get Execution` endpoint to get updates on the current execution status. Once this endpoint is called, your function execution process will start asynchronously.

data.description: String of custom data to send to function.

async.description: Execute code in the background. Default value is false.

get.description: Get a function execution log by its unique ID.
Get a list of all variables of a specific function.

post.description: Create a new function variable. These variables can be accessed within function in the `env` object under the request variable.

get.description: Get a variable by its unique ID.

put.description: Update variable by its unique ID.

delete.description: Delete a variable by its unique ID.

get.description: Check the Appwrite HTTP server is up and responsive.
Check the Appwrite Antivirus server is up and connection is successful.
Check the Appwrite in-memory cache server is up and connection is successful.
Check the Appwrite database server is up and connection is successful.
Get the number of certificates that are waiting to be issued against [Letsencrypt](https://letsencrypt.org/) in the Appwrite internal queue server.
Get the number of logs that are waiting to be processed in the Appwrite internal queue server.
Get the number of webhooks that are waiting to be processed in the Appwrite internal queue server.
Check the Appwrite local storage device is up and connection is successful.

Check the Appwrite server time is synced with Google remote NTP server. We use this technology to smoothly handle leap seconds with no disruptive events. The [Network Time Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_Time_Protocol) (NTP) is used by hundreds of millions of computers and devices to synchronize their clocks over the Internet. If your computer sets its own clock, it likely uses NTP.

Get the current user location based on IP. Returns an object with user country code, country name, continent name, continent code, ip address and suggested currency. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.

([IP Geolocation by DB-IP](https://db-ip.com))
List of all continents. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.
List of all countries. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.
List of all countries that are currently members of the EU. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.
List of all countries phone codes. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.
List of all currencies, including currency symbol, name, plural, and decimal digits for all major and minor currencies. You can use the locale header to get the data in a supported language.
List of all languages classified by ISO 639-1 including 2-letter code, name in English, and name in the respective language.

Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name, teamId

get.description: Get a list of all the storage buckets. You can use the query params to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: enabled, name, fileSecurity, maximumFileSize, encryption, antivirus

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Create a new storage bucket.

bucketId.description: Unique Id. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

permissions.description: An array of permission strings. By default no user is granted with any permissions. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

fileSecurity.description: Enables configuring permissions for individual file. A user needs one of file or bucket level permissions to access a file. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

maximumFileSize.description: Maximum file size allowed in bytes. Maximum allowed value is 30MB. For self-hosted setups you can change the max limit by changing the `_APP_STORAGE_LIMIT` environment variable. [Learn more about storage environment variables](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/self-hosting/environment-variables#storage)

allowedFileExtensions.description: Allowed file extensions. Maximum of 100 extensions are allowed, each 64 characters long.

compression.description: Compression algorithm choosen for compression. Can be one of none,  [gzip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gzip), or [zstd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zstd), For file size above 20MB compression is skipped even if it's enabled

encryption.description: Is encryption enabled? For file size above 20MB encryption is skipped even if it's enabled

antivirus.description: Is virus scanning enabled? For file size above 20MB AntiVirus scanning is skipped even if it's enabled

get.description: Get a storage bucket by its unique ID. This endpoint response returns a JSON object with the storage bucket metadata.

put.description: Update a storage bucket by its unique ID.

permissions.description: An array of permission strings. By default the current permissions are inherited. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

fileSecurity.description: Enables configuring permissions for individual file. A user needs one of file or bucket level permissions to access a file. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

maximumFileSize.description: Maximum file size allowed in bytes. Maximum allowed value is 30MB. For self hosted version you can change the limit by changing _APP_STORAGE_LIMIT environment variable. [Learn more about storage environment variables](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/self-hosting/environment-variables#storage)

allowedFileExtensions.description: Allowed file extensions. Maximum of 100 extensions are allowed, each 64 characters long.

compression.description: Compression algorithm choosen for compression. Can be one of none, [gzip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gzip), or [zstd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zstd), For file size above 20MB compression is skipped even if it's enabled

encryption.description: Is encryption enabled? For file size above 20MB encryption is skipped even if it's enabled

antivirus.description: Is virus scanning enabled? For file size above 20MB AntiVirus scanning is skipped even if it's enabled

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name, signature, mimeType, sizeOriginal, chunksTotal, chunksUploaded

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description:
Create a new file. Before using this route, you should create a new bucket resource using either a [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket) API or directly from your Appwrite console.

Larger files should be uploaded using multiple requests with the [content-range](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Range) header to send a partial request with a maximum supported chunk of `5MB`. The `content-range` header values should always be in bytes.

When the first request is sent, the server will return the **File** object, and the subsequent part request must include the file's **id** in `x-appwrite-id` header to allow the server to know that the partial upload is for the existing file and not for a new one.

If you're creating a new file using one of the Appwrite SDKs, all the chunking logic will be managed by the SDK internally.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

fileId.description: File ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

permissions.description: An array of permission strings. By default the current user is granted with all permissions. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

get.description: Get a file by its unique ID. This endpoint response returns a JSON object with the file metadata.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

put.description: Update a file by its unique ID. Only users with write permissions have access to update this resource.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

permissions.description: An array of permission string. By default the current permissions are inherited. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

delete.description: Delete a file by its unique ID. Only users with write permissions have access to delete this resource.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

get.description: Get a file content by its unique ID. The endpoint response return with a 'Content-Disposition: attachment' header that tells the browser to start downloading the file to user downloads directory.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

get.description: Get a file preview image. Currently, this method supports preview for image files (jpg, png, and gif), other supported formats, like pdf, docs, slides, and spreadsheets, will return the file icon image. You can also pass query string arguments for cutting and resizing your preview image. Preview is supported only for image files smaller than 10MB.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Resize preview image width, Pass an integer between 0 to 4000.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Resize preview image height, Pass an integer between 0 to 4000.

parameters.name: gravity
parameters.description: Image crop gravity. Can be one of center,top-left,top,top-right,left,right,bottom-left,bottom,bottom-right

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Preview image quality. Pass an integer between 0 to 100. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: borderWidth
parameters.description: Preview image border in pixels. Pass an integer between 0 to 100. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: borderColor
parameters.description: Preview image border color. Use a valid HEX color, no # is needed for prefix.

parameters.name: borderRadius
parameters.description: Preview image border radius in pixels. Pass an integer between 0 to 4000.

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: Preview image opacity. Only works with images having an alpha channel (like png). Pass a number between 0 to 1.

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: Preview image rotation in degrees. Pass an integer between -360 and 360.

parameters.name: background
parameters.description: Preview image background color. Only works with transparent images (png). Use a valid HEX color, no # is needed for prefix.

parameters.name: output
parameters.description: Output format type (jpeg, jpg, png, gif and webp).

get.description: Get a file content by its unique ID. This endpoint is similar to the download method but returns with no  'Content-Disposition: attachment' header.

parameters.name: bucketId
parameters.description: Storage bucket unique ID. You can create a new storage bucket using the Storage service [server integration](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/storage#createBucket).

get.summary: Get usage stats for a storage bucket

get.description: Get a list of all the teams in which the current user is a member. You can use the parameters to filter your results.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: name, total

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description: Create a new team. The user who creates the team will automatically be assigned as the owner of the team. Only the users with the owner role can invite new members, add new owners and delete or update the team.

teamId.description: Team ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

roles.description: Array of strings. Use this param to set the roles in the team for the user who created it. The default role is **owner**. A role can be any string. Learn more about [roles and permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions). Maximum of 100 roles are allowed, each 32 characters long.

get.description: Get a team by its ID. All team members have read access for this resource.

put.description: Update a team using its ID. Only members with the owner role can update the team.

name.description: New team name. Max length: 128 chars.

delete.description: Delete a team using its ID. Only team members with the owner role can delete the team.

get.description: Get the team activity logs list by its unique ID.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Only supported methods are limit and offset

get.description: Use this endpoint to list a team's members using the team's ID. All team members have read access to this endpoint.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Maximum of 100 queries are allowed, each 4096 characters long. You may filter on the following attributes: userId, teamId, invited, joined, confirm

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter your list results. Max length: 256 chars.

post.description:
Invite a new member to join your team. If initiated from the client SDK, an email with a link to join the team will be sent to the member's email address and an account will be created for them should they not be signed up already. If initiated from server-side SDKs, the new member will automatically be added to the team.

Use the 'url' parameter to redirect the user from the invitation email back to your app. When the user is redirected, use the [Update Team Membership Status](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/client-web/teams#updateMembershipStatus) endpoint to allow the user to accept the invitation to the team. 

Please note that to avoid a [Redirect Attack](https://github.com/OWASP/CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.md) the only valid redirect URL's are the once from domains you have set when adding your platforms in the console interface.

email.description: Email of the new team member.

roles.description: Array of strings. Use this param to set the user roles in the team. A role can be any string. Learn more about [roles and permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions). Maximum of 100 roles are allowed, each 32 characters long.

url.description: URL to redirect the user back to your app from the invitation email.  Only URLs from hostnames in your project platform list are allowed. This requirement helps to prevent an [open redirect](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet.html) attack against your project API.

name.description: Name of the new team member. Max length: 128 chars.

get.description: Get a team member by the membership unique id. All team members have read access for this resource.

patch.description: Modify the roles of a team member. Only team members with the owner role have access to this endpoint. Learn more about [roles and permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

roles.description: An array of strings. Use this param to set the user's roles in the team. A role can be any string. Learn more about [roles and permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions). Maximum of 100 roles are allowed, each 32 characters long.

delete.description: This endpoint allows a user to leave a team or for a team owner to delete the membership of any other team member. You can also use this endpoint to delete a user membership even if it is not accepted.

patch.description:
Use this endpoint to allow a user to accept an invitation to join a team after being redirected back to your app from the invitation email received by the user.

If the request is successful, a session for the user is automatically created.

userId.description: User ID.

You may filter on the following attributes: name, email, phone, status, passwordUpdate, registration, emailVerification, phoneVerification

post.description: Create a new user.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

phone.description: Phone number. Format this number with a leading '+' and a country code, e.g., +16175551212.

password.description: Plain text user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [Argon2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argon2) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [Bcrypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bcrypt) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [MD5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [PHPass](https://www.openwall.com/phpass/) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()`to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [Scrypt](https://github.com/Tarsnap/scrypt) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

passwordSalt.description: Optional salt used to hash password.

passwordCpu.description: Optional CPU cost used to hash password.

passwordMemory.description: Optional memory cost used to hash password.

passwordParallel.description: Optional parallelization cost used to hash password.

passwordLength.description: Optional hash length used to hash password.

post.summary: Create User with Scrypt Modified Password
post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [Scrypt Modified](https://gist.github.com/Meldiron/eecf84a0225eccb5a378d45bb27462cc) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

password.description: User password hashed using Scrypt Modified.

passwordSaltSeparator.description: Salt separator used to hash password.

passwordSignerKey.description: Signer key used to hash password.

post.description: Create a new user. Password provided must be hashed with the [SHA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Hash_Algorithm) algorithm. Use the [POST /users](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#create) endpoint to create users with a plain text password.

userId.description: User ID. Choose your own unique ID or pass the string `ID.unique()` to auto generate it. Valid chars are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, period, hyphen, and underscore. Can't start with a special char. Max length is 36 chars.

passwordVersion.description: Optional SHA version used to hash password. Allowed values are: 'sha1', 'sha224', 'sha256', 'sha384', 'sha512/224', 'sha512/256', 'sha512', 'sha3-224', 'sha3-256', 'sha3-384', 'sha3-512'

get.summary: Get usage stats for the users API

get.description: Get a user by its unique ID.

delete.description: Delete a user by its unique ID, thereby releasing it's ID. Since ID is released and can be reused, all user-related resources like documents or storage files should be deleted before user deletion. If you want to keep ID reserved, use the [updateStatus](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/cloud/server-nodejs/users#updateStatus) endpoint instead.

patch.description: Update the user email by its unique ID.

get.description: Get the user activity logs list by its unique ID.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Array of query strings generated using the Query class provided by the SDK. [Learn more about queries](https://appwrite.io/docs/products/databases/queries). Only supported methods are limit and offset

get.description: Get the user membership list by its unique ID.

patch.description: Update the user name by its unique ID.
Update the user password by its unique ID.

password.description: New user password. Must be at least 8 chars.

patch.description: Update the user phone by its unique ID.

get.description: Get the user preferences by its unique ID.

patch.description: Update the user preferences by its unique ID. The object you pass is stored as is, and replaces any previous value. The maximum allowed prefs size is 64kB and throws error if exceeded.

get.description: Get the user sessions list by its unique ID.

delete.description: Delete all user's sessions by using the user's unique ID.
Delete a user sessions by its unique ID.

patch.description: Update the user status by its unique ID. Use this endpoint as an alternative to deleting a user if you want to keep user's ID reserved.

status.description: User Status. To activate the user pass `true` and to block the user pass `false`.

patch.description: Update the user email verification status by its unique ID.
Update the user phone verification status by its unique ID.

tags.name: account
tags.description: The Account service allows you to authenticate and manage a user account.

tags.name: avatars
tags.description: The Avatars service aims to help you complete everyday tasks related to your app image, icons, and avatars.

tags.name: databases
tags.description: The Databases service allows you to create structured collections of documents, query and filter lists of documents

tags.name: locale
tags.description: The Locale service allows you to customize your app based on your users' location.

tags.name: health
tags.description: The Health service allows you to both validate and monitor your Appwrite server's health.

tags.name: projects
tags.description: The Project service allows you to manage all the projects in your Appwrite server.

tags.name: storage
tags.description: The Storage service allows you to manage your project files.

tags.name: teams
tags.description: The Teams service allows you to group users of your project and to enable them to share read and write access to your project resources

tags.name: users
tags.description: The Users service allows you to manage your project users.

tags.name: functions
tags.description: The Functions Service allows you view, create and manage your Cloud Functions.

$updatedAt.description: Database update date in ISO 8601 format.

$createdAt.description: Collection creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Collection update date in ISO 8601 format.

documentSecurity.description: Whether document-level permissions are enabled. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

total.description: Total number of attributes in the given collection.

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

min.description: Minimum value to enforce for new documents.

max.description: Maximum value to enforce for new documents.

default.description: Default value for attribute when not provided. Cannot be set when attribute is required.

$createdAt.description: Document creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Document update date in ISO 8601 format.

userId.description: User ID.

ip.description: IP session in use when the session was created.

time.description: Log creation date in ISO 8601 format.

osCode.description: Operating system code name. View list of [available options](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/docs/lists/os.json).

clientCode.description: Client code name. View list of [available options](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/docs/lists/clients.json).

$createdAt.description: User creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: User update date in ISO 8601 format.

registration.description: User registration date in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: User status. Pass `true` for enabled and `false` for disabled.

passwordUpdate.description: Password update time in ISO 8601 format.

phone.description: User phone number in E.164 format.

prefs.description: User preferences as a key-value object

timeCost.description: Amount of time consumed to compute hash

threads.description: Number of threads used to compute hash.

$createdAt.description: User creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: User update date in ISO 8601 format.

registration.description: User registration date in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: User status. Pass `true` for enabled and `false` for disabled.

passwordUpdate.description: Password update time in ISO 8601 format.

phone.description: User phone number in E.164 format.

prefs.description: User preferences as a key-value object

$createdAt.description: Session creation date in ISO 8601 format.

userId.description: User ID.

expire.description: Session expiration date in ISO 8601 format.

providerAccessTokenExpiry.description: The date of when the access token expires in ISO 8601 format.

ip.description: IP in use when the session was created.

osCode.description: Operating system code name. View list of [available options](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/docs/lists/os.json).

clientCode.description: Client code name. View list of [available options](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/docs/lists/clients.json).

current.description: Returns true if this the current user session.

$createdAt.description: Token creation date in ISO 8601 format.

userId.description: User ID.

secret.description: Token secret key. This will return an empty string unless the response is returned using an API key or as part of a webhook payload.

expire.description: Token expiration date in ISO 8601 format.

country.description: Country name. This field support localization.

continentCode.description: Continent code. A two character continent code "AF" for Africa, "AN" for Antarctica, "AS" for Asia, "EU" for Europe, "NA" for North America, "OC" for Oceania, and "SA" for South America.

continent.description: Continent name. This field support localization.

eu.description: True if country is part of the Europian Union.

$createdAt.description: File creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: File update date in ISO 8601 format.

$createdAt.description: Bucket creation time in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Bucket update date in ISO 8601 format.

fileSecurity.description: Whether file-level security is enabled. [Learn more about permissions](https://appwrite.io/docs/advanced/platform/permissions).

compression.description: Compression algorithm choosen for compression. Will be one of none, [gzip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gzip), or [zstd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zstd).

$createdAt.description: Team creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Team update date in ISO 8601 format.

total.description: Total number of team members.

$createdAt.description: Membership creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Membership update date in ISO 8601 format.

userId.description: User ID.

invited.description: Date, the user has been invited to join the team in ISO 8601 format.

joined.description: Date, the user has accepted the invitation to join the team in ISO 8601 format.

confirm.description: User confirmation status, true if the user has joined the team or false otherwise.

$createdAt.description: Function creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Function update date in ISO 8601 format.

schedule.description: Function execution schedult in CRON format.

scheduleNext.description: Function's next scheduled execution time in ISO 8601 format.

schedulePrevious.description: Function's previous scheduled execution time in ISO 8601 format.

base.description: Base Docker image used to build the runtime.

$createdAt.description: Deployment creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Deployment update date in ISO 8601 format.

entrypoint.description: The entrypoint file to use to execute the deployment code.

activate.description: Whether the deployment should be automatically activated.

status.description: The deployment status. Possible values are "processing", "building", "pending", "ready", and "failed".

buildTime.description: The current build time in seconds.

$createdAt.description: Execution creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Execution upate date in ISO 8601 format.

trigger.description: The trigger that caused the function to execute. Possible values can be: `http`, `schedule`, or `event`.

status.description: The status of the function execution. Possible values can be: `waiting`, `processing`, `completed`, or `failed`.

response.description: The script response output string. Logs the last 4,000 characters of the execution response output.

stdout.description: The script stdout output string. Logs the last 4,000 characters of the execution stdout output. This will return an empty string unless the response is returned using an API key or as part of a webhook payload.

stderr.description: The script stderr output string. Logs the last 4,000 characters of the execution stderr output. This will return an empty string unless the response is returned using an API key or as part of a webhook payload.

duration.description: The script execution duration in seconds.

$createdAt.description: Project creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Project update date in ISO 8601 format.

$createdAt.description: Webhook creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Webhook update date in ISO 8601 format.

security.description: Indicated if SSL / TLS Certificate verification is enabled.

signatureKey.description: Signature key which can be used to validated incoming

$createdAt.description: Key creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Key update date in ISO 8601 format.

expire.description: Key expiration date in ISO 8601 format.

accessedAt.description: Most recent access date in ISO 8601 format.

sdks.description: List of SDK user agents that used this key.

$createdAt.description: Domain creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Domain update date in ISO 8601 format.

secret.description: OAuth 2.0 application secret. Might be JSON string if provider requires extra configuration.

enabled.description: Provider is active and can be used to create session.

$createdAt.description: Platform creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Platform update date in ISO 8601 format.

type.description: Platform type. Possible values are: web, flutter-ios, flutter-android, ios, android, and unity.

key.description: Platform Key. iOS bundle ID or Android package name.  Empty string for other platforms.

store.description: App store or Google Play store ID.

hostname.description: Web app hostname. Empty string for other platforms.

$createdAt.description: Variable creation date in ISO 8601 format.

$updatedAt.description: Variable creation date in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: Antivirus status. Possible values can are: `disabled`, `offline`, `online`

size.description: Amount of actions in the queue.

ping.description: Duration in milliseconds how long the health check took.

status.description: Service status. Possible values can are: `pass`, `fail`

remoteTime.description: Current unix timestamp on trustful remote server.

localTime.description: Current unix timestamp of local server where Appwrite runs.

diff.description: Difference of unix remote and local timestamps in milliseconds.

value.description: The value of this metric at the timestamp.

date.description: The date at which this metric was aggregated in ISO 8601 format.

range.description: The time range of the usage stats.
